title: Embedded Dense Neural Networks for Battery Cyclability Prediction on Automotive Microcontroller Devices
venue: Harvard Library Office for Scholarly Communication
excerpt: This paper explores the development of a testing methodology in the context of accurately predicting future battery performance using machine learning. In particular, I propose a Dense Neural Network Model that can predict battery life using data from the first 50 cycles in the battery life.
citation: Rotaru, A. (2021). "Embedded Dense Neural Networks for Battery Cyclability Prediction on Automotive Microcontroller Devices" Harvard Library Office for Scholarly Communication

title: The effects of Caloric restriction on the Biological Indices of Homeostasis
venue: MoldSEF National Science and Engineering Fair
excerpt: This paper studies the benefits of a caloric restrictive diet on preventing aging. In order to study the benefits of this type of diet, this paper compares the amount of antioxidants in the blood of rats under dietary restriction and in rats with normal diet. The results of the experiment can be used to explain how a dietary restriction can increase longevity. The findings might be useful in convincing people to adopt a new pattern in food consumption – reducing the daily amount of calories by 30%, thus improving life quality.
citation: Rotaru, A., Tataru, E. (2016). "The effects of Caloric restriction on the Biological Indices of Homeostasis"

title: Angiotensin 1-7 blunts in vitro induced acute heart failure
venue: European Journal of Heart Failure, 2017; The 4th World Congress on Acute Heart Failure, Paris, France, 29 April – 2 May 2017
excerpt: Angiotensin 1-7 (Ang 1-7) comprises consistent evidences regarding cardiovascular regulatory benefits due to Ang II receptor AT1 modulation via mass receptor.
citation: Cobet, V., Rotaru, A., et al., (2017). Angiotensin 1-7 blunts in vitro induced acute heart failure. European Journal of Heart Failure, 19 (S1), 597. https://doi.org/10.1002/ejhf.833

title: Vanhoutte and Bowditch phenomena in heart failure: their relation to ischemia-reperfusion impact
excerpt: Evaluation of both 15,16-epoxyeicosatrien (15,16-EET) induced coronaro dilation and Bowditch’s staircase in experimental heart failure (HF) as well as their influence on ischemic contracture and functional recovery of isolated heart during reperfusion impact.
citation: Tacu, L., Rotaru, A., et al. (2018). Vanhoutte and Bowditch phenomena in heart failure: their relation to ischemia-reperfusionimpact. European Journal of Heart Failure, 20 (S1), 335.  https://doi.org/10.1002/ejhf.1197

title: Coronary response in doxorubicin-induced cardiomyopathy
venue: European Journal of Heart Failure, 2017; The 4th World Congress on Acute Heart Failure, Paris, France, 29 April – 2 May 2017
excerpt: Coronary reserve and reactivity traits regarding doxorubicin (Dx) car-diotoxicity are less known comparatively to myocardial contraction and inotropiccapacities.Aim:the in vitro evaluation of coronary response to natural vasotropic agent actionin Dx-induced cardiomyopathy (Dx-CMP).
citation: Cobet, V., Rotaru, A., et al. (2017). Coronary response in doxorubicin-induced cardiomyopathy. European Journal of Heart Failure, 19 (S1), 165.  https://doi.org/10.1002/ejhf.833
